title: theBalancedBriefNLtech
description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from theBalancedBriefNLtech, skipping any feeds with errors.

items.title: CES Live Blog, Day 1: The Coolest Tech We’ve Seen So Far
items.description: Read our live updates from CES 2026 in Las Vegas to see the latest consumer gadgetry in all of its chatbot-enabled, sensor-packed, AI-infused glory.

items.title: Flutterwave buys Nigeria’s Mono in rare African fintech exit
items.description: Africa’s largest fintech company, Flutterwave, has acquired Nigerian open banking startup Mono in an all-stock deal valued between $25 million and $40...

items.title: Kodiak taps Bosch to scale its self-driving truck tech
items.description: There is no timeline for when these systems will become available. But once they do, Kodiak could bring its tech to more trucks, faster.

items.title: At CES 2026, Everything Is AI. What Matters Is How You Use It

items.title: I Switched to eSIM, and I Am Full of Regret
items.description: Switching between mobile phones used to be easy. Then came eSIM.

items.title: Flu Is Relentless. Crispr Might Be Able to Shut It Down
items.description: Innovative research into the gene-editing tool targets influenza’s ability to replicate—stopping it in its tracks.

items.title: French and Malaysian authorities are investigating Grok for generating sexualized deepfakes
items.description: France and Malaysia have joined India in condemning Grok for creating sexualized deepfakes of women and minors.

items.title: DoorDash says it banned driver who seemingly faked a delivery using AI
items.description: DoorDash seems to have confirmed a viral story about a driver using an AI-generated photo to lie about making a delivery.

items.title: Can a social app fix the ‘terrible devastation’ of social media?
items.description: Twitter co-founder Biz Stone and Pinterest co-founder Evan Sharp have raised new funding for a social media app that helps users "plan with intention....
